comments: Eclipse does not recognise any of my java installations, when i try add one i get The currently displayed page contains invalid values, or am told the the directory i selected does not contain a valid executable.  My OS version is 10.4.3, i cannot get it to work with java 1.4.2 or 1.5.  This is extremely frustrating as this problem did not exist in version 3.0, i cannot use v 3 because i need java 1.5.
Kim, have you seen this problem?

Nope, I've never had a problem with this.  

Have you customized your java installs with custom plists or install locations?

(In reply to comment #2)
> Nope, I've never had a problem with this.  
> 
> Have you customized your java installs with custom plists or install locations?
> 

No customization's have been done, Eclipse v3.0 works fine and can find all java installations with no problems, please see attachments for screen captures and the help/about/config details

Created an attachment (id=33098)
Invalid values error

Created an attachment (id=33099)
Not able to find executable error

Created an attachment (id=33100)
Unable to find during search error

Created an attachment (id=33101)
Config

If you go to /System/Library/Frameworks/JavaVM.framework/Versions/1.5.0/Home/bin in finder do you see the java executable?

Also... dare I ask... are you running on Intel?

Yep just checked, there is an executable in there and no i'm not using intel.  I do use 1.5 for running java apps and i'm having to use netbeans until i can get this sorted out and i'm compiling with my 1.5 installation.
Your JRE Home directory is /System/Library/Frameworks/JavaVM.framework/Versions/1.5.0/Home, not /System/Library/Frameworks/JavaVM.framework/Versions/1.5.0/Home/bin.
Sorry went one to far on the path, it makes no difference.  I've taken the bin path off and still get the same issues see new attachment

Created an attachment (id=33106)
Add error

I've added the jars myself

(In reply to comment #12)
> Created an attachment (id=33106) [edit]
> Add error
> 
> I've added the jars myself
> 

please note, this is not restricted to just 1.5, i cannot add 1.4.2 either
What version of Eclipse are you using? I have no problem adding VM installs to the latest Integration build, but the Installed JRE's page on my machine is not the same as yours.

Version: 3.2.0
Build id: I20051102-1600

Thanks for you time and effort on this and apologies for being a pain :)

It looks like this issue may have been resolved already, though I can't find a specific bug report to point to towards.
I recommend that you give 3.2 M4 a try. I just tried installing a VM on a clean install of M4 with a clean workspace and it went smoothly.

Is there anything relevant in your error log?

will try m4 a.s.a.p mean while here is a stack trace when i try to go into installed jre's

How are you installing eclipse?  Are you unzipping one version on top of another?

I downloaded the suggested version (eclipse-platform-3.2M4-macosx-carbon.tar.gz) and unzipped into an empty folder, ran eclipse ok and used a new workspace location and then used the update manager to get the jdt, reset the workspace and tried to look at installed jre's.

Mmm.  My guess is that M4 is incompatible with the version of the JDT you're installing from the update manager.  Could you try and download the full SDK instead of just the platform?  The full SDK is available here:  http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops/S-3.2M4-200512151506/download.php?dropFile=eclipse-SDK-3.2M4-macosx-carbon.tar.gz
I can smile again, this version now recognizes all my java installs.  Thanks everyone for your time.
Thanks for reporting back.

traces.message: The activator org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.JDIDebugUIPlugin for bundle org.eclipse.jdt.debug.ui is invalid
